q1.text: What are the system requirements for the installation?

answers.text: The system requirements for the installation are Microsoft Windows 10 or newer (32 or 64 bit), Microsoft Access 2013 or newer (32 bit), and LAN or wireless connection (for multi-user configuration).
.accdb is a file extension used for Microsoft Access database files. It is a file format used to store database information, including tables, queries, forms, reports, macros, and modules.

q3.text: How can multiple users work on a SRP project simultaneously? How can they view, edit and report project data?

answers.text: In order for multiple users to work on a SRP project simultaneously, the project data files must be stored in a shared server directory where users can attach to projects from their copy of the SRP application. To accomplish this, install a full set of SRP system files on the local drive on each user's workstation, confirm that the sharing option for Microsoft Access is set to "Shared" on each PC, and confirm that all users are connected to the network and have full read/write permission to access the server and shared directories. When a project is opened, the project that was last open is re-attached automatically. The SRP system is designed to allow multiple people on the team to input, edit and run reports, and do this in any order. The system does not impose a step by step linear process to follow, so that you can be as flexible and responsive as the project demands.

Rapid Applications Development (RAD) is a software development methodology that emphasizes rapid prototyping and iterative development. The Access development environment is conducive to RAD, allowing developers to quickly create and modify database applications.

q5.text: How does SRP provide flexibility in circulation factors?

answers.text: SRP provides flexibility in circulation factors by allowing users to set up to three cumulative circulation factors for a project, assign circulation factors in up to four ways (at the Project level, the optional Groupings level, the Area Types level, and as an Override to specific Area Types for specific Departments), and set or change the naming, formatting, display options, and actual multipliers at any point in the project. Additionally, each group and each Area Type can have a different circulation factor, and when the factor is set to [0], there is no circulation area generated.

q6.text: What are the editors in Earnest SRP?

answers.text: The editors in Earnest SRP are Microsoft Access forms, sometimes referred to as "Screens". They are the tools designed for the end-user to input, change or delete data in the database. You can open almost all Earnest SRP editors directly from buttons on the Main Screen. The editors display either one record at a time, or multiple records at a time.

q7.text: Differentiate between Datasheet View and Form View.

answers.text:
Datasheet View and Form View are two different ways of viewing and editing data in a Microsoft Access database. 

In Datasheet View, the form displays records in a tabular (table) view. You can edit, add or delete records in this view just as you do in Form view. You can resize the columns or rows to see more data. In Datasheet View, you can edit records (just as you do in Form View), adjust the size and position of the fields (columns), filter and sort records on any field, and re-assign records to other departments. 

In Form View, the form displays one record at a time, and is used for editing data in a more structured way. You can use the record navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen to move between records. In Form View, you can edit the data in the fields, add new records, delete records, and navigate between records. You can also use the form to perform calculations, display data from related tables, and run macros or VBA code. 

In summary, Datasheet View is used for viewing and editing data in a tabular format, while Form View is used for viewing and editing data in a more structured way, one record at a time.

q8.text: What is the difference between deleting text and deleting a record?

answers.text: The significant difference between deleting text and deleting a record is that deleting text removes only the value in a field, while deleting a record removes the entire set of fields. To delete text, you can highlight the text and press the Delete key or cut the text by pressing Ctrl + X. To delete a record, you need to select the correct record and press the Delete command button. It is important to note that deleting any record should be done only after careful consideration.
